ibmcloud-appid.note: dependency spdx-exceptions,spdx-license-ids uses CC0-1.0 indicates no copyright
dependency spdx-exceptions uses CC-BY-3.0 allows broad use with attribution

ibm_db.note: buffers package that ibm_db depends on specifies MIT indirectly

@stoplight/prism-cli.note: dependency tslib@2.3.1 reports 0BSD which is less restrictive than BSD
dependency fastestsmallesttextencoderdecoder@1.0.22 reports CC0-1.0 which gives up all rights

@elastic/elasticsearch.note: dependency tslib@2.3.1 reports 0BSD which is less restrictive than BSD

node-rdkafka.note: dev depdency on domhandler, domutil and entities which are under BSD like reported as BSD*
depends on argparse which is under Python-2.0
dev dependency toolkit-jsdoc appears to be UNLICENCED (reports as Undefined) and shoujld not be installed, not required for non-dev use
dependency taffydb reports an unknown licence but repo says it is BSD-2-Clause on npm

mongodb.note: dependency tslib@2.3.1 reports 0BSD which is less restrictive than BSD

@ibm-cloud/secrets-manager.note: dependency npm uses Artistic-2.0 which allows any use but no modifications
dependency spdx-exceptions,spdx-license-ids uses CC0-1.0 indicates no copyright
dependency spdx-exceptions uses CC-BY-3.0 allows broad use with attribution

citgm.note-1: ibmcloud-appid, @ibm-cloud/cloudant, opossum, ibm_db are Red Hat/IBM modules that would need broader usage before being considered for CITGM
citgm.note-2: cldr-localenames-full does not have tests as it is a data delivery module and therefore does not beong in CITGM
citgm.note-3: eslint and mocha look to be permanently skipped in CIGTM due to needing headless chrome to run tests
citgm.note-4: node-rdkafka, rhea, odbc, @openapitools/openapi-generator-cli, openapi-backend, @stoplight/prism-http, express-openapi-validator, swagger-editor, openapi-editor have low download numbers and will be skipped in CITGM
citgm.note-5: kafkajs, @elastic/elasticsearch, helmet, passport propose additions to CITGM in the future
citgm.note-6: nano, express-prom-bundle, i18next-icu, i18next-http-middleware, i18next-fs-backend review in the future to see if they make sense to add to CITGM

note: opencollective uses an old version of node-fetch. opencollective is used to ask for funding and the reported vulnerability is not a concern in that module

an older version of node-fetch is also used by swagger-editor through isomorphic-fetch, Red Hat and Synk both assessed the node-fetch vuln as medium instead of high as reported by npm so suppress related failures
CVE-2022-0235.name: node-fetch

note: opencollective uses an old version of minimist. opencollective is used to ask for funding and the reported vulnerability is not a concern in that module
mocha uses an old version of mkdirp. mocha is used for testing and the proptotype pollution vuln is not a concern in that module
CVE-2021-44906.name: minimist

note: opencollective uses an old version of minimist. opencollective is used to ask for funding and the reported vulnerability is not a concern in that module
CVE-2020-7598.name: minimist

note: swagger-editor uses an old version of minimist. opencollective is used to ask for funding and the reported vulnerability is not a concern in that module

swagger-editor isomorphic-fetch which uses node-fetch. The github and CVE list the severity as low/medium, while what is returned by the query to the github db says high in one place and low in the other. This is unlikely to be an issue in use in swagger-editor and it seems like the rating should be low so just allow

swagger-client uses cross-fetch which uses node-fetch. The github and CVE list the severity as low/medium, while what is returned by the query to the github db says high in one place and low in the other. This is unlikely to be an issue in use in swagger-editor and it seems like the rating should be low so just allow
CVE-2020-15168.name: node-fetch

note: node-rdkafka uses a version of mocha that uses an old version of minimatch, as mocha is a test package used in dev, the ReDoS impact/risk is likely low
CVE-2022-3517.name: minimatch
